decomposition.intro: The task of organizing a one-day TED talk event involves a variety of specialized areas to ensure its success. To effectively manage the complexity of the task, I have broken it down into 7 key functional subtasks.

subtasks.description: Responsible for overall logistics and coordination of the event.
Handling all aspects related to the speakers participating in the event.
Promoting the event to attract attendees and create buzz.
Managing attendee registration and ticket sales.
responsibilities: Checking in attendees on the event day

subtasks.description: Ensuring all technical aspects of the event run smoothly.
responsibilities: Testing tech systems before the event
Providing tech support during the event

subtasks.description: Securing sponsorships and forming partnerships to support the event.
Overseeing operations and managing the event on the day of the TED talks.
responsibilities: Handling any on-site issues or emergencies

Event Planning.original: Research and select a suitable date for the TED talks event
Scout and finalize a venue that can accommodate the event requirements
Develop a detailed event schedule outlining the timing of each talk and break
Reach out to potential speakers to confirm availability and topic of presentation
Coordinate with sponsors to secure funding and confirm their involvement in the event

Speaker Management.original: Create a list of potential speakers and send out invitations
Follow up with invited speakers to confirm their participation and topics
Coordinate travel arrangements and book accommodations for the speakers
Prepare and distribute detailed speaker guidelines including presentation format and time limits

Marketing and Promotion.original: Conduct market research to identify target audience and their preferences
Design and produce visually appealing promotional materials such as flyers and banners
Create a content calendar for social media posts leading up to the event
Collaborate with influencers or partners for promotional activities
Monitor and analyze the performance of social media campaigns to optimize reach and engagement

Registration and Ticketing.original: Create an online registration form with fields for attendee information such as name, email, and contact number
Set up ticketing system with different ticket types (e.g., regular, VIP) and corresponding prices
Monitor ticket sales and respond to inquiries regarding registration and ticketing
Prepare and organize the attendee check-in process for the event day, including staff training and equipment setup

Technical Support.original: Coordinate with the venue to ensure availability of necessary audiovisual equipment
Conduct thorough testing of microphones, projectors, and sound systems prior to the event
Prepare backup tech systems in case of any failures during the event
Provide on-site tech support for speakers and attendees throughout the event

Sponsorship and Partnerships.original: Research and create a list of potential sponsors based on relevance to the event's theme and target audience.
Reach out to potential sponsors to present sponsorship opportunities and negotiate terms of the partnership.
Develop sponsorship packages outlining benefits and deliverables for sponsors at different levels of investment.
Establish and maintain communication with partners to ensure their needs are met and maximize their involvement in the event.

On-site Coordination.original: Coordinate with vendors to ensure timely setup of the event venue
Create and communicate a detailed schedule to volunteers and staff outlining their roles and responsibilities
Establish an on-site communication protocol and chain of command for handling emergencies
